comment: This professor is very difficult to figure out. I think she can be extremely harsh with her criticism so much that it isn't helpful, but rather discouraging. I've already seen and heard students withdrawing her classes and even changing their majors because of how rude she is, which is sad. Very hard to sit through her class without feeling tense.

One of the best Professors Ive had by far. I was struggling with an assignment, trying to use Photoshop. She let me use her iPad and sat with me, teaching me how to use Procreate. She is the reason I started digital art. I feel way more confident after taking her course.  Super caring, open, and passionate. Very easy to talk too.A+ will take again.

Had Professor Mishra for Sequential Art I. She was a fairly good professor, attendance is extremely mandatory so do not skip. She may seem a little harsh at first but she warms up later on. She's also good at asking questions to the class during critique to make sure she's not biased in her grading.
She is very nice and helpful! I had her for sequential art and her class was easy and she also built a community out of her class so we all talked with one another.

Find any other professor, do not be fooled by the kind facade. She will openly bully students. Is also inconsiderate of students disabilities and accomodations. Only 2 of 30 assignments were graded by the end of the semester. Lies about expectations. Do not take her.
She is a good professor but make sure you are in class ON TIME and participating

Picks favorites, grades off of energy rather than work. This was my first 90 in an art class, I fought all semester for extra credit to receive an A. Ended up asking for less hours working to afford the time for this class, workload is about equal to a language class.

This professor's assignments just felt like practice for concepts we learned in previous beginning classes. I had 0 takeaways from this class. She is also fairly hard to communicate with as she either doesn't listen to you or isn't willing to understand you. She expects you to stick to one continuous style and gives very contradictory critiques.

The projects arent hard aside from the criteria changing randomly. Not very helpful when it comes to wanting to try something new with your work; wouldn't take the class again. Takes attendance very seriously.

I would say Ms.Shuchita is a nice person, but not the best professor. There were assignments due every week which led to the class often having to ask for date extensions/submitting half finished work. Multiple times she changed guidelines of projects while we had already begun and got frustrated when we ended up doing the assignment "incorrectly".

She's really nice and a good professor. She really cares about her students and tries to give them many opportunities (to sell art, meet industry professionals, etc). She allowed us to use either Procreate or Photoshop, though I wish she only used PS though because it's the industry standard and I learned very little about PS in this class.

Shuchita can feel like she gives hard deadlines or be very strict when giving feedback, but they're really just loosely there to keep you on track to hopefully finish your project on time nor is she as strict as she seems. The projects she gives are very enjoyable, is very kind and will work with you to make the best work you can.
